item.title: By: David Bunis
item.dc:creator: David Bunis
item.description: Hello Michael, I've just seen your delightful piece of over a year ago on the Ottoman postcards illustrating the cultural mix that was (and to an extent, still is) Ottoman Constantinople. I'd be glad to keep up with any publications you've devoted to this since. My area is the Judezmo or Ladino language of the Sephardic Jews of the empire. I wonder if you have come across any cards, photos, etc. illustrating the use of Judezmo along with other languages of the empire. If so, I'd really like to see them - and would of course credit you in any publications in which I make use of them. Best wishes, David Bunis Hebrew University of Jerusalem (where we once had a nice program in Armenian Studies - until our expert retired...)
item.content:encoded:
Hello Michael,
I’ve just seen your delightful piece of over a year ago on the Ottoman postcards illustrating the cultural mix that was (and to an extent, still is) Ottoman Constantinople. I’d be glad to keep up with any publications you’ve devoted to this since. My area is the Judezmo or Ladino language of the Sephardic Jews of the empire. I wonder if you have come across any cards, photos, etc. illustrating the use of Judezmo along with other languages of the empire. If so, I’d really like to see them – and would of course credit you in any publications in which I make use of them.
Best wishes,
David Bunis
Hebrew University of Jerusalem (where we once had a nice program in Armenian Studies – until our expert retired…)
